snippet: As Myanmar reconnects to the rest of the world, the fractious and insurgency-plagued states of Northeast India that share a 1000-mile border with Myanmar may be quietly transforming themselves from roadblock to bridge, a shift that could impact India...
abstract: As Myanmar reconnects to the rest of the world, the fractious and insurgency-plagued states of Northeast India that share a 1000-mile border with Myanmar may be quietly transforming themselves from roadblock to bridge, a shift that could impact India and China. Read the first story in a three-part series at India Ink.

headline.main: In India's Northeast, Peace Threatens to Break Out
